data.title: Elections: Algerian Presidency 2004 General
data.text:
At stake in this election:

The office of President of Algeria

Description of government structure:

Chief of State: President Abdelaziz BOUTEFLIKA

Head of Government: Prime Minister Ahmed OUYAHIA

Assembly: Algeria has a bicameral Parliament consisting of the National People's Assembly (Al-Majlis Ech-Chaabi Al-Watani) with 389 seats and the Council of Nations (Senate) with 144 seats.

Description of electoral system:

The President is elected by direct popular vote to serve a 5-year term.

In the National People's Assembly (Al-Majlis Ech-Chaabi Al-Watani) 389 members are elected by popular vote to serve 5-year terms. In the Council of Nations (Senate), 96 members are elected by indirect vote to serve 6-year terms and 48 members are appointed to serve 6-year terms.**

** One-third of the seats are appointed by the president while the remaining two-thirds are secured by indirect votes. National Council members have a six-year term, and 50% of the seats are renewed every three years.

Main Candidates in the Presidential race:

Adbelaziz BOUTEFLIKA*

Party: Society of Peace Movement (MSP) and National Democratic Assembly (RND)

Ali BENFLIS

Party: National Liberation Front (FLN)

Abdallah DJABALLAH

Party: Islamic El Islah Movement

Said SADI

Party: Liberal Rally for Culture and Democracy

Louiza HANOUNE

Party: Workers Party

Ali Faouzi REBAINE

Party: AHD Party

* BOUTEFLIKA was backed by a coalition including the RND, the MSP, and rebel members of the National Liberation Front (FLN).

Last Presidential election:

Last presidential election was held on April 15, 1999. In this election, Abdelaziz BOUTEFLIKA won the presidency with over 70% of the votes, after his opponents withdrew from the race citing electoral fraud.

Population and number of registered voters:

Population: 32,818,500 (July 2003 est.)

Registered Voters: 18,097,225 (2004)

Gender Data:

· Female Population: 16,049,150 (2004)

· Is Algeria a signatory to CEDAW: No

· Has Algeria ratified CEDAW: Yes, accession (22 May 1996)

· Gender Quota: Yes

· Female candidates in this election: No

· Number of Female Parliamentarians: 26 (6.68%) (2002)

· Human Development Index Position: 83 (2014)

· Social Institutions and Gender Index (SIGI) Categorization: N/A

Disability Data:

· Is Algeria a signatory to CRPD: Yes (30 March 2007)

· Has Algeria ratified CRPD: Yes (4 December 2009)

· Population with a disability: 4,922,775 (est.)
